solution_line_template: First find the total length of the appointments: {num_appointments} appointments * {hours_per_appointment} hours/appointment = <<{num_appointments}*{hours_per_appointment}={total_appointment_hours}>>{total_appointment_hours} hours

Then subtract that time from the length of Andrew's workday to find how many hours he spends stamping permits: {total_workday_hours} hours - {total_appointment_hours} hours = <<{total_workday_hours}-{total_appointment_hours}={stamping_hours}>>{stamping_hours} hours

Then multiply that number by the number of permits he can stamp per day to find how many permits he stamps: {permits_per_hour} permits/hour * {stamping_hours} hours = <<{permits_per_hour}*{stamping_hours}={total_permits_stamped}>>{total_permits_stamped} permits
